poem:
Title: "Shifts in Elephantine Cloth"

Once crimson, now a darker shade, the party shifts its hue,
Akin to dawn swapping the night's ensemble for the day's new blue.
Leaders bound in thought, yet discord hums beneath the vow,
Searching through the fog of crime for the constitutional now. 
Like actors poised on shifting sand, under the trumpet's blare,
Bearing the cross of loyalty, heavy in the political square.
